original: Ljunggren, Gunnar Victor, leg. läkare, Göteborg, f. 13/2/11 i Sthlm av dir. Victor L. o. Anna Maria Lund. G. 44 m. leg. läk. Brita Lange. Barn: Anna-Margareta f. 45, Marie 47. –Stud:ex. v. södra latin i Sthlm 30, med. kand. v. Karol. inst. 34, med. lic. där 41. E. o. aman. v. histolog. inst. v. Karol. inst. 34-35, kort. tjg. v. sanat. i Arvika, RK:s sjukhem i Sthlm samt kir. avd. I å Sabbatsbergs sjukh. 41, tjg. v. krigssjukh. i Finl. vintern 41-42, tf. und:läk. v. kir. avd. å las. i Skellefteå 43, v. kir. avd. å las. i Halmstad kort. tid 44, assist :läk., extraläk. samt tf. und:läk. v. kir. avd. I å Sahlgrenska sjukh. i Gbg 45-46, assist :läk. samt tf. und:läk. v. röntgenavd. I där 47.
translated:
Ljunggren, Gunnar Victor, licensed physician, Gothenburg, b. 13/2/11 in Stockholm, son of director Victor L. and Anna Maria Lund. Married in 1944 to licensed physician Brita Lange. Children: Anna-Margareta b. 1945, Marie b. 1947. 

Education: Graduated from Södra Latin School in Stockholm in 1930, obtained medical candidate degree from Karolinska Institute in 1934, obtained medical license from the same institute in 1941. Temporary assistant at the histology institute at Karolinska Institute in 1934-1935, brief service at Sanatorium in Arvika, RK's Hospital in Stockholm and Surgical Department I of Sabbatsbergs Hospital in 1941. Served at a military hospital in Finland during the winter of 1941-1942, acting assistant physician at the surgical department in Skellefteå hospital in 1943, at the surgical department in Halmstad hospital for a short time in 1944. Assistant physician, locum physician, and acting assistant physician at the surgical department I of Sahlgrenska Hospital in Gothenburg in 1945-1946, assistant physician and acting assistant physician at the radiology department I there in 1947.

workExperience.jobTitle: Assistant Physician, Locum Physician, Acting Assistant Physician
